sentences.sContent: Cut off a piece of wood 5 cm in length.
sentences.sCn: 截下一段五厘米长的木头。

sentences.sContent: His trousers were held up with a piece of string.
sentences.sCn: 他的裤子靠一根细绳系着。

sentences.sContent: Would you like a small or a large piece?
sentences.sCn: 你想要一小块还是一大块？

sentences.sContent: Chop the potato into bite-sized pieces.
The shower head just came to pieces (= broke into separate parts ) in my hand.
sentences.sCn: 花洒就在我手中裂开了。

sentences.sContent: ...It is going to be a piece of cake...
...I played a small piece at the school concert...
...I really enjoy that piece you just played on the piano...
...Joel Stein wrote　an extensive piece on Millennials and he remains rather optimistic about our potential...
...you can highlight a piece of content and make notes...
...I really enjoy that piece you just play on the piano...
...I have enough money to buy that piece of land I’ve had my eye on and build a house on it...

phrases.pCn: 工作物；半制品；被加工件
轻而易举的事情；轻松愉快的事
难事；一件作品；一项工作

粗加工工件；粗加工部分；首片
试样；制取试样的金属块；[音]参赛或命题曲目
一段音乐；一首音乐；一首乐曲

trans.tranOther: an amount of something that has been separated from the main part
to put all the separate parts of sth together to make a complete whole
